publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2099# Margaret Jamieson: Nursery Nurses—That the Parliament recognises the valuable contribution of nursery nurses in the provision of early years education and the significant impact which the Regulation of Care (Scotland) Act 2001 will have in relation to this contribution; congratulates the public services union UNISON on its campaign to raise the profile of nursery nurses, and looks forward to the success of the on-going discussions between UNISON and employers to create a career structure for nursery nurses which is appropriately remunerated. R
S1M-2099# Nursery Nurses (lodged on 3 August 2001) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-2099# Margaret Jamieson: Nursery Nurses—That the Parliament recognises the valuable contribution of nursery nurses in the provision of early years education and the significant impact which the Regulation of Care (Scotland) Act 2001 will have in relation to this contribution; congratulates the public services union UNISON on its campaign to raise the profile of nursery nurses, and looks forward to the success of the on-going discussions between UNISON and employers to create a career structure for nursery nurses which is appropriately remunerated. R Supported by: Fiona Hyslop, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Tommy Sheridan, Pauline McNeill*, Mike Watson*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-2099# Nursery Nurses (lodged on 3 August 2001) Shona Robison*
S1M-2099# Nursery Nurses (lodged on 3 August 2001) Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-2099# Nursery Nurses (lodged on 3 August 2001) Maureen Macmillan*, Ms Sandra White*, Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-2099# Nursery Nurses (lodged on 3 August 2001) Dr Richard Simpson*, Elaine Smith*

S1M-2099# Margaret Jamieson: Nursery Nurses-That the Parliament recognises the valuable contribution of nursery nurses in the provision of early years education and the significant impact which the Regulation of Care (Scotland) Act 2001 will have in relation to this contribution; congratulates the public services union UNISON on its campaign to raise the profile of nursery nurses, and looks forward to the success of the on-going discussions between UNISON and employers to create a career structure for nursery nurses which is appropriately remunerated. R Supported by: Fiona Hyslop, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Tommy Sheridan, Pauline McNeill, Mike Watson, Irene Oldfather, Shona Robison, Brian Fitzpatrick, Maureen Macmillan, Ms Sandra White, Cathy Jamieson, Dr Richard Simpson, Elaine Smith, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-2099# Nursery Nurses (lodged on 3 August 2001) Trish Godman*, Janis Hughes*, Karen Gillon*

S1M-2099# Margaret Jamieson: Nursery Nurses—That the Parliament recognises the valuable contribution of nursery nurses in the provision of early years education and the significant impact which the Regulation of Care (Scotland) Act 2001 will have in relation to this contribution; congratulates the public services union UNISON on its campaign to raise the profile of nursery nurses, and looks forward to the success of the on-going discussions between UNISON and employers to create a career structure for nursery nurses which is appropriately remunerated. R Supported by: Fiona Hyslop, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Tommy Sheridan, Pauline McNeill, Mike Watson, Irene Oldfather, Shona Robison, Brian Fitzpatrick, Maureen Macmillan, Ms Sandra White, Cathy Jamieson, Dr Richard Simpson, Elaine Smith, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Cathie Craigie, Rhoda Grant, Mr Andy Kerr, Hugh Henry, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Trish Godman, Janis Hughes, Karen Gillon, Dennis Canavan*
